MajorClaims.MC1: it is not the good idea for teenagers to have job while they are still students
MajorClaims.MC2: it can interfere with their life in various ways
MajorClaims.MC3: for a teenager it is important to pay attention on their studies

Claims.C1: many argue that it provide good working experience
Claims.C2: Having jobs would affect the health of the student
Claims.C3: It divert their mind from studies and would take away their childhood phase from their life
Claims.C4: Having job would affect their health, divert them from studies and take away one of the important phase from their life
Claims.C5: would affect their mental and physical health
Claims.C6: If the student get involved himself in job in rest of the time, then it would cause an extra burden on them
Claims.C7: jobs can divert students from their studies
Claims.C8: they should take advantage of life as much possible they can

Premises.P1: jobs has various responsibilities like attendance, sometimes extra work and so on
Premises.P2: This would result in stress, tension and tiredness
Premises.P3: They won't be able to get proper time for relaxation, sleep
Premises.P4: He has to spend his most of time in school to get a good grades
Premises.P5: A student has to do lots of studies in today's competitive world to prove himself
Premises.P6: If students started earning in earlier age in their life, then they get attracted towards money
Premises.P7: They feel themselves independent and would prefer to work more for money
Premises.P8: This would affect their studies, they loose their interest from studies
Premises.P9: they drop out their studies so as to earn more money
Premises.P10: the main drawback of teenagers job is that, they miss out the fun of their childhood time
Premises.P11: They have whole life to do job and prove themselves, but the childhood phase will never return in their life
Premises.P12: He would miss various childhood activities such as hang out with friends, clubs and fun activities and social interaction with others
